Header: Arjun Aloysius and Kasun Palisena granted bail
Content: Owner of the Perpetual Treasuries Arjun Aloysius and CEO of the same company Kasun Palisena who had been remanded in connection with Central Bank bond scam have been released on bail. The bail was granted by Chief Magistrate of Colombo Lanka Jayaratne. Arjun Aloysius and Kasun Palisena were in remand custody for around one year. They were released on a cash bail of one million rupees and a personal bond of 20 million rupees per each accused. The Chief Magistrate stated that the personal bonds should be close relatives. The Magistrate also suspended overseas travels of the suspects. The suspects were ordered to appear before the Criminal Investigation Department on every last Sunday of the month. The bail was granted considering the health condition of children of the two suspects. Meanwhile, the Colombo Chief Magistrate ordered to re-remand former Prisons Superintendent Emil Ranjan Lamahewa till 8th of this month in connection with assassinating 27 inmates of the Welikada prison. The suspect was ordered to be further remanded by Additional Magistrate Priyantha Liyanage. Emil Ranjan Lamahewa has also filed a bail application. The Criminal Investigation Department informed the court that investigations pertaining to the incident have not completed yet. IP Neomal Rangajeewa of the Police Narcotics Bureau who was also in remand custody regarding the same incident was granted bail previously. The Colombo Magistrate’s Court ordered to further examination of witnesses of the case against former Minister Wimal Weerawansa’s wife Shashi Weerawansa. She has been accused for forging a general passport and diplomatic passport providing false information to the Department of Immigration and Emigration. A statement was recorded from retired Deputy Registrar General Sumathipala Hettirarachchi. The case was fixed to 14th of this month.
